intro: Hieracium prominentidens, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its showy yellow flowers are surrounded by a ring of pale yellow to white ray florets, making it visually striking. Hieracium prominentidens is an herbaceous perennial that can spread aggressively through its rhizomes, often forming dense colonies.
